main event: Multiple bright-colored objects, described as a series of lights, were observed in the sky over Indianapolis, Indiana in the early morning hours of March 23, 1960.
interesting points: The objects were described as being the size of a dime at arm's length, with a light that would blink on and off.
The objects were first seen in the northwest, going southeast, and seemed to 'sail down' before disappearing by just blinking out.
The witness could not give an exact size for the objects, but described them as bright-colored and looking like a series of lights.
Other witnesses in the area had reported similar sightings of the objects.
The sighting lasted for approximately 30 seconds to 3/4 minutes.
sighted object: multiple bright-colored objects, described as a series of lights
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
